Instrument_PDS3.instrument_desc:
Instrument Overview =================== This file contains a brief statement of the characteristics of the CCD47 camera. For details, the reader is referred to
http://www.ccd.com/pdf/ccd_47.pdf
Scientific Objectives ---------------------
High-speed imaging of the LCROSS impact site.
Calibration -----------
Dark and bias corrections done by collecting unilluminated exposures of the same exposure times. Flat fielding is done with sky flat field images.
Operational Considerations --------------------------
The instrument is manually operated through a GUI control. The data acquisition software was a fits saver program written for this output.
Detectors:
The CCD47 camera has a1024 x 1024 array of 13-micron pixels, which were binned as 16 pixels x 16 pixels for the LCROSS observations. The decision to bin these pixels was made in order to trade readout rate against spatial pixel size. The camera reads out at a rate of 12.689 Hz, or 78.808 ms/frame. Of this total time, 71.269 ms is the exposure length. The remainder is the time required to read out the chip. The CCD47 camera is not cryogenically or mechanically cooled. This is an engineering-grade CCD.
Location:
Internal to the f/15 secondary natural guide star top box of the MMT Observatory.
Operational Modes:
Frame-transfer mode with the 12.689 Hz, or 78.808 ms/frame, clocking readout rate.
